physical_examinations.vital_signs: Absolute neutrophil count was 2.3 x 10^9 cells/L; within 48 hours, it dropped to 0.5 x 10^9 cells/L.
physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Tender palpable purpuric plaques on both cheeks and ear lobes with central areas of necrosis.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Neutropenia improved with treatment using filgrastim; skin lesions resolved spontaneously.

physical_examinations.vital_signs: Laboratory data showed an absolute neutrophil count less than 1.0 x 10^9 cells/L.
physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Many exquisitely tender erythematous plaques with central necrosis on her thighs, lower extremities, and buttocks; necrotic lesion on the nose.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Lesions and neutropenia improved rapidly with treatment using steroids.
